Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 13th overall pick, by Chicago in 2017...
Traded from Chicago to New York on 5/16/2018 (Going to NY: LF Mark Starr. Going to CHI: P Roberto Ortiz, P Samuel Ramos, 2B Richard Zapata)...
Had first career hit on 5/22/2018, off Nickolas Orduna (KC)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/30/2018, off Columbus Willingham (BRO)...
Traded from New York to Chicago on 6/20/2020 (Going to CHI: 2B Robert Serrano, LF Mark Starr, P Luis Cabello, P Lesley Simoneau, 1B Andres Armendariz. Going to NY: 2B John James, RF Kevin McGuire)
...
Injured on 7/28/2020 with a Broken Hand, out for 6-7 weeks...
Hit for the cycle against Houston on 4/27/2021...
Traded from Chicago to Houston on 6/10/2021 (Going to CHI: P Jacob Wingert, 2B Deivi Alvarez. Going to HOU: CF Mark Starr, CF Rigo Fano)...
1/31/2022: Gets a new one-year contract worth $671,429 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Houston to Atlanta on 2/20/2022 (Going to HOU: RF Gregory Arrington. Going to ATL: SS Philip Davies, CF Mark Starr)...
1/31/2023: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,221,429 through salary arbitration...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/5/2023, hitting .452 with 1 HR, 11 RBI...
Was selected to the 2023 Allstar game...
1/31/2024: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,442,857 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 8/2/2024 with a Fractured Hip, out for 9-10 weeks...
8/4/2024: Signed a contract extension with Atlanta, $3,500,000 per year, for 2 years.
